entry.title: I figured out how the mail system works
entry.content:
The email only send one email at 16:00 (UTC+1) of each day.
Well, nothing to worry about!
entry.summary:
The email only send one email at 16:00 (UTC+1) of each day.
Well, nothing to worry about!

entry.title: Just a random new post to test email delivery system
entry.content:
Let‚Äôs test

Are you going to sent this new post to my subscriber, Google FeedBurner??

Please do it!
entry.summary:
Let‚Äôs test

Are you going to sent this new post to

entry.title: This is a post without images
entry.content:
Yes. This is a post without any kind of images, including thumbnail, cover, etc.

The reason why of making this post is that the mailing system didn‚Äôt push the last post (the one with images of iOS mail app) to the subscribed email.
I suspect that it is because of the images: FeedBurner‚Äôs useless server is not willing to store my images and push them to my mail.
entry.summary: Yes. This is a post without any kind of images, including thumbnail, cover, etc.

entry.title: Email subscription system is working, but there's still something weird...
entry.content:
After doing some Google FeedBurner stuff, I managed to subscribe my own blog with my own email.

So this is the first ‚Äúblog update‚Äù email I have ever received:

Well, what is the ‚Äúwerid thing‚Äù that I‚Äôve talked before?
Look at this, google still thought that I have zero subscribers. Maybe it just refreshes at a slow manner. So nothing to worry about right now, since the system is working normally.

Update 2021-04-16

Seems like that my email is successfully subscribed to my blog üòä I‚Äôm happy.
entry.summary: After doing some Google FeedBurner stuff, I managed to subscribe my own blog with my own email.

entry.title: üìå Hexo Development Checklist
entry.content:
ü•≥ ü§® ü§¨
Here you can find my Hexo-Dev checklist and some useful hexo documentations

Checklist:

  • Favicon and logo (solved)
  • Live 2d widget (solved 2021-04-14)
  • TOC (table of contents) (solved 2021-04-15)
  • Email subscription system (solved 2021-04-15)
  • Share (solved 2021-04-15)
  • Category (solved 2021-04-17)
  • Create ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù page (solved 2021-04-17)
  • Pin an article to top (solved 2021-04-17)
  • Visitors of each post
  • high light/mark
  • Visitor-traffics map
  • Change the Size of the Logo Done, but not checked on mobile device
  • Comments (no Ad)
  • limit height of 
     and
  • Abbreviation Change
  • Sitemap
  • Widget Graphviz
  • Change the tags style in the post page
  • Change the article-meta line
  • Weather widget
  • Fold a part of the tags
  • Fold a part of the archives
  • Code highlight
  • ‚ÄúResources‚Äù list here (includes lots of useful documentations) which is basically a bunch of links (Under construction)
  • Double live2d widget (?? worth it?)
  • Complete ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù page

Useful Documentations

Everything nedded:

  • Fabulous guide

General

  • Blog of the dev of the icarus theme
  • Markdown syntax

TOC

  • Strange behaviour of TOC solution

After deleted that plugin, the normal TOC showed up:

Email subscription system

  • A bilibili video
  • RSS generator plugin download
  • Google FeedBurner

Wait wait, what does this mean? So there will be no email subscription via FeedBurner since this July? NOOOO!

Comments (Disqus)

  • Follow this recipe
  • Disqus official site

Share

First, I chose ShareThis because the dev of this theme icarus also uses this plugin. But then I realized that something is wrong with ShareThis. So I changed to AddThis, which works perfecly now.

  • The complete guide
  • Sharethis official site
  • AddThis official site

ShareThis unexpected behaviour:

Categories

I didn‚Äôt consult any documents, I figured it out by myself üòÜ. Just add this to the header of my .md file:

Tags and Categories are pretty much the same thing.

Insert the code below to header of the .md file to get sub-category called ‚Äúsubcat1‚Äù:

‚ÄúAbout‚Äù page

Just type this at terminal and excute:

Pin an article to top

  • The complete guideAfter the installation make sure to type down ‚Äútop: True‚Äù in the header of the .md file.

Abbreviation Change

*[HB]: hemoglobin
HB
entry.summary:
ü•≥ ü§® ü§¨
Here you can find my Hexo-Dev checklist and some useful hexo documentations

entry.title: Successfully changed live 2d widget
entry.content:
I successfully changed live 2d widget to a cat (well the ideal for me is some mecha-stylled widget wwww). The next step is to add two of them, one on the right side and another on the left.

First thing to do is to install the 2d widget helper:

Next, install the model that I wanted: hijiki the cat:

Then add the following code to the main ‚Äú_config.yml‚Äù file (not the ‚Äú_config.yml‚Äù of the theme):

Then everthing works normally.
entry.summary: I successfully changed live 2d widget to a cat (well the ideal for me is some mecha-stylled widget wwww). The next step is to add two of them, one on the right side and another on the left.

entry.title: Maybe I found the reason of the incorrectness of the Safari tab favicon
entry.content:
Soooo actually the safari tab favicon of newer pages is correct.
<(ÔΩÄ^‚Ä≤)> Now I‚Äôm using Chrome. It is way better for web development!

My explaination of the bad Safari favicon is:

I don‚Äôt have that image in my local folders, hence the old favicon has to be stored in a Safari server. The favicon should be somehow ‚Äúassociated‚Äù to my blog‚Äôs link, so every time that some one opens my blog‚Äôs main page, Safari will put the icon stored in Safari‚Äôs server into user‚Äôs Safari tab icon. The old icon is not refreshed in the server end.
When I create a new page, a new link is created. Then, the Safari‚Äôs server will store the correct favicon which is associated only to my new pages, but not the old ones.
Solution: wait maybe one week or one month. Let‚Äôs see if the lazy Safari server refresh :/
entry.summary:
Soooo actually the safari tab favicon of newer pages is correct.
<(ÔΩÄ^‚Ä≤)> Now I‚Äôm using Chrome. It is way better for web development!

entry.title: Let's try to make a table of content
entry.content:
Issue: table of content not working correctly
Behaviour: no highlight of the current section; can‚Äôt jump to a title by clicking on it.

Solution: delete a plugin called ‚Äúhexo-toc‚Äù that I‚Äôve installed previously using this command:

So here is my test text:

Enjoy üòë

entry.title: Doggo Vaccine
entry.content:
Doggo got a vaccine ehehe.
We went to a veterinary clinic at Arroios to get her a vaccine.

The vaccination was a success. Everyone is happy.
entry.summary:
Doggo got a vaccine ehehe.
We went to a veterinary clinic at Arroios to get her a vaccine.

entry.title: I give up
entry.content:
Damn it. I have been working on this for say more than 4 hours, but the damn Safari favicon never changed at all. Where the fuck did the Safari get that old favicon? WHERE IS THAT GOD DAMN OLD IMAGE‚Äôs SOURCE FILE??? WHERE IS MY NEW IMAGE???
The source code (index.html) says that everything is in its place. But the God Damn favicon didn‚Äôt refresh.

Everyting is working on Chrome. The shortcut icon on Safari works perfectly. Why the stupid tab icon didn‚Äôt change?

I already tried:
1: Open my website at Private mode (Safari)
2: Delete all Safari favicon cache that I found in this directory:

3: Restart computer
Nothing above worked!
But the Chrome has everything CORRECT! Damn it.
No more hexo for today. I was really happy when I can put image on my site in the afternoon, but now I‚Äôm kinda pissed off.
Oh btw, it was quite boring typing ‚Äúhexo clean‚Äù, ‚Äúhexo g‚Äù and ‚Äúhexo d‚Äù. Not to mention the time that you have to wait between these commands. I found that this is a ‚Äúcompact version‚Äù of deploy command, it‚Äôs quite handy:
entry.summary:
Damn it. I have been working on this for say more than 4 hours, but the damn Safari favicon never changed at all. Where the fuck did the Safari get that old favicon? WHERE IS THAT GOD DAMN OLD IMAGE‚Äôs SOURCE FILE??? WHERE IS MY NEW IMAGE???
The source code (index.html) says that everything is in its place. But the God Damn favicon didn‚Äôt refresh.

entry.title: Solved site logo not appearing in a hilarious way
entry.content:
Just RESIZE that God Damn safari window and my logo (fraud alert! XD) appeared!
Now I finally solved the logo problem, one more to go:
favicon displays differentely on Safari and Chrome wtf?
entry.summary:
Just RESIZE that God Damn safari window and my logo (fraud alert! XD) appeared!
Now I finally solved the logo problem, one more to go:

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Run server
